Instrument_Host.name: The Suisei Spacecraft
Instrument_Host.description: The Suisei spacecraft, twin of the Sakigake spacecraft, was similarly designed and built by the precursors to the modern Japanese Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA). A twin to Sakigake in disk-like shape and construction, Suisei carried a different science payload - specifically, a UV imager and a solar wind instrument. Suisei followed Sakigake to comet 1P/Halley and took images of the comet's hydrogen corona over 30 days as the comet passed down through the ecliptic plane. Known as "Planet-A" prior to launch, the spacecraft was renamed Suisei after successful launch.
